items.creator: Ann Gynn
items.title: 15 Mistakes You May Be Making in Your Content Development
items.dc:creator: Ann Gynn
items.content:
When you talk mistakes, are you usually referring to typos, grammatical errors, and misspellings? That granular focus could be your biggest gaffe. Let’s look at 15 of the biggest mistakes in content creation, production, and promotion processes. Continue reading →

The post 15 Mistakes You May Be Making in Your Content Development appeared first on Content Marketing Institute.

items.title: Tools to Help Your Content Marketing Team Be Successful
items.dc:creator: Shane Barker
items.content:
No matter where your team works, the challenge remains – how to work efficiently in individual roles and as a content marketing team. Here’s a list of go-to tools that helps writers and editors work well across time zones.
Continue reading →

items.creator: Ann Gynn
items.title: Can Clickbait Be Used for Good?
items.dc:creator: Ann Gynn
items.content:
Clickbait has a well-deserved bad rap. Yet, attracting an audience and getting it to click to a web page is a goal for many content marketers. Can you create clickbait that gets a good rap? Let’s discuss. Continue reading →

The post Can Clickbait Be Used for Good? appeared first on Content Marketing Institute.

items.content:

items.creator: David McGuire
items.title: 5 Big Obstacles Encountered by B2B Content Marketers
items.dc:creator: David McGuire
items.content:
Every corner of B2B is drowning in identikit, low-value content. Why? Complicated subject matter, stuffy audiences, and restrictive brand compliance? No, they don’t even make the list. Continue reading →

items.creator: Sasha LaFerte
items.title: Style Guide: How to Write One for Your Brand
items.dc:creator: Sasha LaFerte
items.content:
Branding fails often happen because of a lack of a clear style guide, which results in inconsistencies or miscommunication. Learn what a style guide can do for your brand, what to include in it, and get inspired by a couple examples. Continue reading →

The post Style Guide: How to Write One for Your Brand appeared first on Content Marketing Institute.

items.title: How to Make Personal and Corporate Branding Work Together
items.dc:creator: Ann Gynn
items.content:
You and your co-workers have professional personal brands. Your employer has a corporate or business brand. They are intertwined. Now, it’s time to be smarter about that connection and make it mutually beneficial.
Continue reading →

items.creator: Robert Rose
items.title: Do You Know Flat-Earth Marketers? [The Weekly Wrap]
items.dc:creator: Robert Rose
items.content:
This week, Robert Rose ponders flat-earth marketing. He talks with A. Lee Judge about whether marketing is keeping its fair share of budget, and all things video. Plus, he points to an article on when to make –and break – content rules. Continue reading →
